intro: Townsendia sericea var. leptotes, commonly known as the slender Townsend's tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
